alert.note: Alert for Harney; Malheur (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 4:45PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT/9 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dry washes and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oregon, including the following counties, Harney and Malheur. * WHEN...Until 800 PM PDT /900 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 445 PM PDT /545 PM MDT/, Trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This will cause dry washes and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Crooked Creek, Jordan Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Mosquito Creek, Little Alvord Creek, Dry Creek, Indian Creek and Tuffy Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rome, Burns Junction, Fields, Twin Buttes, Whitehorse Ranch, Three Man Butte, Howluk Butte, Willow Creek Hot Springs, Mickey Butte, Buckskin Mountain, Table Mountain, Alvord Hot Springs, Rome Airport, Basque Station, Flat Top Mountain, Twin Peaks, Schoolhouse Hill, Coffin Butte, Mann Lake and Antelope Spring. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
